item.title: The Fate of Google’s Ad Tech Monopoly Is Now in a Judge’s Hands
item.description: A judge queried lawyers about whether a breakup made sense during closing arguments on how to fix the tech giant’s dominance in online advertising.

item.title: America Is Setting a Trap for Itself
item.description: The United States, not China, seems determined to upend the global order.

item.title: As Trump Pushes on Russia-Ukraine Peace Plan, Zelensky’s Options Are Narrowing
item.description: The Ukrainian president’s options are narrowing as he is confronted with a 28-point proposal drafted by American and Russian envoys.

item.title: To Many Ukrainians, U.S. Peace Plan Looks Like ‘Capitulation’
item.description: While the White House has cautioned that the proposal is still in “flux,” its contours reflect maximalist demands made by Russia throughout the war th...

item.title: European Leaders Back Zelensky After Trump’s Russia-Ukraine Peace Plan Excludes Them
item.description: A U.S.-Russian proposal would require Kyiv to give up territory and reduce its army. If Moscow complies with the terms, it could receive benefits incl...
